title: Juvenile with ‘airsoft replica weapon’ determined to have caused UMass Lowell lockdown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A juvenile male caused a UMass Lowell lockdown with an airsoft replica weapon, prompting a massive police response.
The incident involved numerous law enforcement agencies, including the FBI and ATF, and lasted three hours with no injuries reported.
Authorities are still deciding whether the juvenile will face criminal charges for the airsoft gun incident.

title: A new BBJ report rejiggers the list of state’s wealthiest zip codes. Here’s who’s on top now.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Back Bay's 02116 now tops Massachusetts' wealthiest zip codes, surpassing Dover with a $1.3 million median home value.
Boston Business Journal's Wealth Index considers income, home ownership, and values from Zillow and Census data.
Discover which three Cambridge zip codes made the top 10 wealthiest list in Massachusetts.

title: Wu admin. to send nearly 100 recent police academy grads to Mass. and Cass
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston to deploy nearly 100 new police academy graduates to Mass. and Cass area.
Move aims to combat outdoor substance use and crime, amid increasing public complaints.
Discover the strategy updates and public health measures detailed in a city memo.

title: Could cocoa help delay high blood pressure? Here’s what Brigham and Women’s researchers found.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Brigham and Women's Hospital study suggests cocoa extract may help older adults maintain normal blood pressure.
Long-term cocoa extract use linked to a 24% lower risk of developing hypertension in those with systolic pressure under 120 mmHg.
Researchers advise against equating chocolate consumption with cocoa's health benefits; further analysis of trial data is needed.

title: Here’s a list of 2025 Patriots predictions from beat writers and national analysts
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots analysts predict a mixed 2025 season, with records ranging from 7-10 to 9-8.
New head coach and significant roster changes fuel cautious optimism despite past 4-13 records.
Find out which analytics expert used simulations to predict 8.8 wins for the Patriots.

title: Couple climbs through sunroof to help screaming toddler left in car at South Shore shopping plaza
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A Brockton mother faces charges for leaving her toddler in a hot car at Hingham's Derby Street Shops.
A couple rescued the child by climbing through the sunroof and calling 911 for assistance.
Discover how long the mother left the child unattended while shopping.

title: Readers: How do you feel about Bill Belichick’s college football debut?
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Bill Belichick debuted as UNC's head coach, facing a 48-14 loss to TCU.
Belichick joined UNC after 23 seasons with the Patriots, winning six Super Bowls.
UNC's performance raises questions about Belichick's adaptation to college football.

title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Lebanese restaurant BeyA to open in South End with 67 seats and two floors.
Blank Street Coffee replaces Allston's Twin Donuts, preserving iconic neon sign.
Iru in Brookline reopens in October with new dishes after Japan and Korea trip.

title: Prosecutors spent more than $1.4 million to retry Karen Read, records show
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Prosecutors spent over $1.4 million on Karen Read's retrial, far exceeding the $50,000 of her first trial.
Special prosecutor Hank Brennan received $566,000; expert witnesses and other expenses accounted for $850,000 in costs.
Discover how much a crash reconstruction company earned compared to Brennan during the trial.

title: Wednesday’s loss a reminder of daunting road for Red Sox without Roman Anthony
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Roman Anthony sidelined for four weeks with an oblique strain, impacting Red Sox playoff run.
Boston holds second-best MLB record since Anthony's June debut, crucial in leadoff role.
Discover how Boston plans to cope without Anthony and Abreu in the lineup.
